pokemon_anime_leagues.name: Orange League
pokemon_anime_leagues.description: A unique anime-only regional competition featuring 4 Gym challenges in the Orange Archipelago, where Ash competes and earns victory.
participants: Gym Leaders: Cissy, Danny, Rudy, Luana

pokemon_anime_leagues.name: Indigo Plateau Conference
pokemon_anime_leagues.description: The first major Pokémon League Ash enters after earning 8 badges in Kanto and Johto. Ash reaches the Top 16.

pokemon_anime_leagues.name: Johto League Conference
pokemon_anime_leagues.description: Ash competes in the Johto regional competition, reaching Top 8 before being eliminated. There is no official canon winner in the anime.

pokemon_anime_leagues.name: Hoenn League Conference
pokemon_anime_leagues.description: Ash makes it to the Top 8 of the Hoenn League but is defeated by Tyson, who becomes the league's winner in the anime.

pokemon_anime_leagues.name: Sinnoh League Conference
pokemon_anime_leagues.description: Ash reaches the Top 4 in the Sinnoh League Conference, losing to Tobias (who is widely considered the strongest anime trainer before World Coronation Series).

pokemon_anime_leagues.name: Unova League Conference
pokemon_anime_leagues.description: Ash competes in the Unova League Conference, reaching the quarterfinals/Top 8 before being defeated.

pokemon_anime_leagues.name: Kalos League Conference
pokemon_anime_leagues.description: Ash makes it to the finals of the Kalos League, ultimately finishing as Runner-Up to Alain.

pokemon_anime_leagues.name: Alola League / Manalo Conference
pokemon_anime_leagues.description: Ash earns his first major league victory as Champion of the Alola League (Manalo Conference), the first time he wins an official Pokémon regional league in the anime. :contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}

pokemon_anime_leagues.name: World Coronation Series (Global)
pokemon_anime_leagues.description: A worldwide competition to rank and find the strongest Trainers from all regions. Ash becomes World Monarch (World Champion) after defeating Leon in the Masters Eight Tournament. :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}
